The '''Human Bullet Yo-Yo''' is the technique derived from {{translation|"Formation E"|フォーメーションE|Fōmēshon Ī}} used by the 16th generation of the [[Team Asuma|Ino–Shika–Chō]] trio.

== Usage ==
[[File:Nikudan Yōyō 2.png|left|thumb|The mechanism behind the technique.]]
In performing this technique, Chōji firstly [[Multi-Size Technique|increases his size]], while Shikamaru connects their two shadows. At the same time, Ino [[Sensing Technique|detects]] any enemies in the immediate vicinity and [[Sensing Transmission|transmits]] this information directly to Shikamaru. As Chōji begins to attack with the [[Human Bullet Tank]] technique, Ino continues to track their opponents so that Shikamaru can perfectly direct Chōji's movement by [[Shadow Clutch Technique|manipulating the shadow]]. How this formation functions and its overall appearance is akin to a person using a [[wikipedia:yo-yo|yo-yo]], albeit in a destructive manner.

== Trivia ==
* In the telepathic dimension of Ino and Shikamaru, this technique when shown as a silhouette looks similar to [[Wikipedia:Ultra Series|Ultraman]], a superhero who controls a huge yo-yo which is connected with his middle finger and uses it to smash his enemies.
